title: Taxicab number
summary: In mathematics, the nth taxicab number, typically denoted Ta(n) or Taxicab(n), also called the nth Ramanujanâ€“Hardy number, is defined as the smallest integer that can be expressed as a sum of two positive integer cubes in n distinct ways. The most famous taxicab number is 1729 = Ta(2) = 13 + 123 = 93 + 103.
